intro: Trigonotis cavaleriei var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue or white flowers. The plant has slender, ascending stems with opposite, narrow, lanceolate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
